instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 no image
threads.message: hi i have an 820-00165 with no image on screen , board had liquid damge,repaired the board to turn on but now no image.  on L8304 i get 0v, on pin 1 of u8300 (edp_panel_pwr) i get 0v , dosnt seam to be a short reads 0.619 in diode mode, edp_panel_pwr looks like it comes straight from cpu ??? is that right and if it is then is the board screwed ????

threads.title: 820-00165 no image
threads.message: Do you get a light on a USB mouse?

threads.title: 820-00165 no image
threads.message:
Confirm USB actvity first.
If not present, then your problem is not only video.

Disconnect LIO flex and check onboard USB port.
Better ty USB OSX with Link LED.

threads.title: 820-00165 no image
threads.message: yes get a light on a usb mouse and have cpu vcore

threads.title: 820-00165 no image
threads.message:
You must get 3V3 at L8304 in the first few seconds, even without LCD connected.
DP_INT_HPD should go high at same time; if screen connected, of course.

Probably still corrosion somewhere close to LCD connector, backlight circuit, or CPU.

threads.title: 820-00165 no image
threads.message: nope nothing at l8304 on startup , get a steady 10mv at DP_INT_HPD with screen connected
